commit message:
Pull postcode backend code into a separate class to allow for using
elsewhere
Run through all the postcode providers until one works
Move most of the Makefile code into Makefile.common
Update Makefile.common to a better version
Add updatedLocation to PostcodeListener, and use it

Be aggressive with location sources, then switch them off once we've got
some data
Existing postcode data is in threads, which actually need starting...
Discard old location data if it is too old
Set app icon to something more suitable than default
Check location data is no older than 1 minute (not 1 hour!)
Rework when to get new location data entirely
If we've already cleared the listeners, skip the update
Don't check time of null locations
Only use locations up to 200m away
Notice unknown locations from 'What is my postcode?'
Speed up non-UK lookups by skipping UK-only services

Fix issues with requestLocationUpdates being semi-synchronous

We repeatedly call requestLocationUpdates with all of the providers to get
the best information we can, but sometimes it seems to lock instead of
being an async call, and so we only get the first provider. This patch
fixes this by shoving the call into it's own thread.
If we're using the debug keystore, auto-generate it
Save a PostcodeState including current text
Show time of last postcode lookup
Store 'acquiring' state in PostcodeState and restart on resume if partial
Add the test task to Gradle and remove Makefiles
Switch to using PostcodesIO, not WhatItMyPostcode
Test override needs to be a list
Set build tools to something CircleCI actually has
Skip release for dogfood, and add production variant
Don't need Geohash or Base32 any more
Correct various minor issues in the READMEs
